TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AccessibleStates extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies values representing possible states for an accessible object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An accessible object can be associated with one or more of these states.
For more information about the accessibility application, see "Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN) library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the creation of an accessibility-aware chart control, using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlAccessibleObject> classes to expose accessible information. The control plots two curves along with a legend. The `ChartControlAccessibleObject` class, which derives from `ControlAccessibleObject`, is used in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method to provide custom accessible information for the chart control. Because the chart legend is not an actual control based on <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control>, but instead is drawn by the chart control, it does not contain any built-in accessible information. Because of this, the `ChartControlAccessibleObject` class overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject.GetChild%2A> method to return the `CurveLegendAccessibleObject` that represents accessible information for each part of the legend. When an accessible-aware application uses this control, the control can provide the necessary accessible information.
This code excerpt demonstrates using the AccessibleStates enumeration with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject.State%2A> property. See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> class overview for the complete code example.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.a_10_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.a_10_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject#4](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.a_10_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates AlertHigh = int32(268435456)

Docs.summary: The important information that should be conveyed to the user immediately. For example, a battery-level indicator reaching a critical low level would transition to this state, in which case, a blind access utility would announce this information immediately to the user, and a screen magnification program would scroll the screen so that the battery indicator is in view. This state is also appropriate for any prompt or operation that must be completed before the user can continue.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates AlertLow = int32(67108864)

Docs.summary: The low-priority information that might not be important to the user.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates AlertMedium = int32(134217728)

Docs.summary: The important information that does not need to be conveyed to the user immediately. For example, when a battery-level indicator is starting to reach a low level, it could generate a medium-level alert. Blind access utilities could then generate a sound to let the user know that important information is available, without actually interrupting the user's work. Users can then query the alert information any time they choose.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Animated = int32(16384)

Docs.summary: The object that rapidly or constantly changes appearance. Graphics that are occasionally animated, but not always, should be defined as . This state should not be used to indicate that the object's location is changing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Busy = int32(2048)

Docs.summary: A control that cannot accept input in its current condition.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Checked = int32(16)

Docs.summary: An object with a selected check box.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Collapsed = int32(1024)

Docs.summary: The hidden children of the object that are items in an outline or tree structure.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Default = int32(256)

Docs.summary: The default button or menu item.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Expanded = int32(512)

Docs.summary: The displayed children of the object that are items in an outline or tree structure.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates ExtSelectable = int32(33554432)

Docs.summary: The altered selection such that all objects between the selection anchor, which is the object with the keyboard focus, and this object take on the anchor object's selection state. If the anchor object is not selected, the objects are removed from the selection. If the anchor object is selected, the selection is extended to include this object and all objects in between. You can set the selection state by combining this with or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection.RemoveSelection?displayProperty=fullName>. This state does not change the focus or the selection anchor unless it is combined with <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection.TakeFocus?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Floating = int32(4096)

Docs.summary: The object that is not fixed to the boundary of its parent object and that does not move automatically along with the parent.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Focusable = int32(1048576)

Docs.summary: The object on the active window that can receive keyboard focus.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Focused = int32(4)

Docs.summary: An object with the keyboard focus.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates HasPopup = int32(1073741824)

Docs.summary: The object displays a pop-up menu or window when invoked.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates HotTracked = int32(128)

Docs.summary: The object hot-tracked by the mouse, meaning its appearance is highlighted to indicate the mouse pointer is located over it.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Indeterminate = int32(32)

Docs.summary: A three-state check box or toolbar button whose state is indeterminate. The check box is neither checked nor unchecked, and it is in the third or mixed state.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Invisible = int32(32768)

Docs.summary: An object without a visible user interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Linked = int32(4194304)

Docs.summary: A linked object that has not been previously selected.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Marqueed = int32(8192)

Docs.summary: An object with scrolling or moving text or graphics.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Mixed = int32(32)

Docs.summary: A three-state check box or toolbar button whose state is indeterminate. The check box is neither checked nor unchecked, and it is in the third or mixed state.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Moveable = int32(262144)

Docs.summary: A movable object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates MultiSelectable = int32(16777216)

Docs.summary: An object that accepts multiple selected items.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: No state.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Offscreen = int32(65536)

Docs.summary: No on-screen representation. A sound or alert object would have this state, or a hidden window that is never made visible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Pressed = int32(8)

Docs.summary: A pressed object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Protected = int32(536870912)

Docs.summary: A password-protected edit control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates ReadOnly = int32(64)

Docs.summary: A read-only object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Selectable = int32(2097152)

Docs.summary: An object that can accept selection.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Selected = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A selected object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates SelfVoicing = int32(524288)

Docs.summary: The object or child can use text-to-speech (TTS) to describe itself. A speech-based accessibility aid should not announce information when an object with this state has the focus, because the object automatically announces information about itself.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Sizeable = int32(131072)

Docs.summary: A sizable object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Traversed = int32(8388608)

Docs.summary: A linked object that has previously been selected.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Unavailable = int32(1)

Docs.summary: An unavailable object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates Valid = int32(1073741823)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This enumeration value has been deprecated. There is no replacement. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: A valid object. This property is deprecated in [!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/add/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)].
